sub_title: Senior Researcher & Consultant | Project Coordinator | Academic and Expat Coach supporting expats and academicians in their mental and emotional wellbeing
summary:
I am a social anthropologist, passionate about social and behavioural change and helping others!
After finishing my PhD, obtaining several postdoc grants across multiple countries and feeling totally displaced, uprooted, unsettled and without a life, I decided to leave academia and I move to real life. I am now a research consultant, with a focus on migration, gender, and social & behavioural change. 

I bring experience in the design, management and delivery of projects. I have demonstrated  track  record  on  social research and a solid understanding of the links between research, policy and practice.

Highly motivated and results-focused with a proven track record of leading project teams, preparing technical proposals and maintaining strong stakeholder relationships at multiple levels. Consistently ensures that projects are delivered in line with budget, scope, schedule, risks, outcomes, prioritisation, value and benefits. 

I also have a demonstrated  track record in the painful academic track, so I am super familiar in dealing with rejections, the impostor syndrome and a nomadic lifestyle that basically destroyed my personal life. Yet, after destruction, I managed to rebuilt it again, so after re-training as a coach, I now offer my coaching and mentoring services to academics in despair. Don't hesitate to contact me if you need help. It's is tough... www.manana-tambien-abrimos.com
